result.execSummary:
The defendant Dante K. Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 5 days time served. Huber privileges for work. Release to Day Reporting Center. No electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Participate with the Dept. of Vocational Rehabilitation.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
No contact with the victim(s) without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dante K. Bell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dante K. Bell in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Statements made as to sentencing.

Defendant sentenced to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges for work.   Release to Day Reporting Center.  No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* No contact with the victim(s) without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Participate with the Dept. of Vocational Rehabilitation.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Dante K. Bell in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencig hearing. The State requests that this matter be adjourned as the the defendant will testify as a witness in a different case set for jury trial on 09/14/2015. Defense does not object.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante K. Bell in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   Defense counsel has received offer.    Court ordered case adjourned for Projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 10.  Plea and Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dante K. Bell in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante K. Bell in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Paul Tiffin.
Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:15 am.

15RM002374  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-18-2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: JERVELL L., GERVONNI S., JAVON B. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. 
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.   
Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment and Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.
Arraignment scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante K. Bell in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Dante K. Bell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT HAS PRIVATE COUNSEL.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
